channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Toilets dumped, bins overflowing, 30th September
item.description:
All waste bins overflowing and smelling bad. Toilets dumped in street along with more builders waste.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Helmsley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 8, 30th September
item.description:
The floor tiles are coming off possibly because of tree roots pushing it but it’s a tripping hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ardwick Road, West Hampstead, London

item.title: Large hole in road, 30th September
item.description:
Hole in road size of basketball with water spurting out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, South Hill Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Vehicle blocking exit, 30th September
item.description:
Royal Mail vehicle parked for over 2hours so far and still there across drive way blocking vehicle exit and parked on school zig zag yellow lines.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holburne Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Doorway and street path being used as bed for homeless and belongings, 30th September
item.description:
Past few weeks there is a lady sleeping just before the Sainsbury’s entrance and taking up half of the pavement meaning it is a hazard to anyone walking later at night. In the daytime belongings are still left on the pavement while she sits outside Sainsbury’s in the doorway, again obstructing the pathway and entrance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, London Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 75 Leather lane, 30th September
item.description:
I was not able to upload the images I took but the drain is blocked and smells. It is causing a nuisance for customers and bringing lots of flies to the area. If there is an email I can send you the images as there is an issue on the website with upload jpeg images. My email is ryan@the-attendant.com Many thanks, Ryan
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leather Lane, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurring pothole at juntion, 30th September
item.description:
This pothole has undergone various repairs but never to a standard high enough to stop it reappearing. This is dangerous to motorcyclists who have enough to look out for at this junction without having the extra issue of the pothole to contend with
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Photo taken 29th September 2025, near 41 - 43

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrottesley Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Larhe holes / ruts on exit from A2, 30th September
item.description:
Poor road repairs leading to large holes with jagged edges, presenting a hazard to pedestrians or motorcycle riders
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Danson Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner store throwing old produce into the street at closing, 30th September
item.description:
A few of us on Frederick Place have noticed an increase in pest problems - Rats and Foxes over the last few months, and we have witnessed the owner of the "Ryatt Cash and Cary" corner store, at 35 Sandy Hill Road, Throwing fruit and vegetables into the street when closing the store and leaving whole loaves of bread on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Sandy Hill Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: By railway Claremont road, 30th September
item.description:
3 black bin bags dumped

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Claremont Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tyre & armchair dumped, 30th September

Tyre & armchair dumped 3 days ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burwash Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Overgrown ivy bush overhanging significantly on to street, blocking pavement and attracting pests, 30th September
item.description:
The ivy has been growing, uncut for months and is blocking more and more of the pavement. Additionally, it appears to be attracting foxes which seem to be coming and going from the cover it provides

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Nigel Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped and broken paladin on Fletching Road, 30th September
item.description:
Abandoned paladin full of rubbish . Bin is broken and rubbish, which is being added to every day, strewn across Fletching Road. The area is now resembling a council dump and needs to be cleared urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping rubbish, 30th September
item.description:
Various junk has been fly tipped next to the road on Mayplace Lane, by the alleyway leading to Brinklow Crescent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 Recycle bins not been emptied, 30th September
item.description:
Recycle bins not been emptied for some time, they are full and overflowing, foxes are dragging contents all over Roberts Close car park and gardens. As the 4 bins are full tenants are not being able to recycle!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Keightley Drive, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refusal to collect communal bins expecting residents to remove fly-tipped items with threat not to collect, 30th September
item.description:
Ongoing issue with Flytipping in these communal recycling bins. Enfield council have now stated that they will not collect until residents have removed non-recyclable items. This is not the responsibility of the residents as non-residents are fly-tipping. The mess is unsightly and is attracting vermin in a community where several children reside and have to walk through this hazardous mess

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ivinghoe Close, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog mess, 30th September
item.description:
It has been laying on the pavement again for over two weeks. The cleaners cannot miss it but choose to ignore it constantly now multiple people and prams have gone through it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severely overgrown vegetation hanging over the fence., 30th September
item.description:
This particular area has been getting increasingly overgrown to the point where I now have to walk in the road around it as it hangs so low. This is dangerous and not an accessible option for everyone as there is no dropped kerb nearby.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
